titleStmt.title: R. W. Tompkins et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5690

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned Jurors who tried John Welch at the may term of the Jefferson Circuit Court upon an Indictment for the murder of Mrs Gavin, earnestly recommend him to Executive clemency, & pray your Excellency to grant him a pardon

R. W. Tompkins
Henry Penne
A A Quarrier
W. D. Smith
L. Richardson
A L Harding
W. F. Lane
Geo Gouterman
Preston Rogers

I, James P Chambers clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the State of Kentucky do certify that the above named persons, are the names of the Jurors who tried and convicted John Welch of the crime of murder, at the last May term of said Court
Witness my hand as clerk aforesaid this 13th July 1864
